commit_message:
Allow to set default instance boot source

This introduces a new config option `DEFAULT_BOOT_SOURCE` to allow
operators to configure a default instance boot source.

Change-Id: Ia9b0d1d24ae69958b6606b9a645bd54f70b3aacc
Implements: blueprint default-instance-boot-source

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-04 21:05:34.000000000', 'message': 'podman_container: configure cpuset_cpus automatically

Port what was done in I9443ad60affe9c7823b17daa259efee542c6fe22

Limit the specific CPUs or cores a container can use.

If cpuset-cpus is configured in the container layout, then the value
will be used when running the container cli with --cpuset-cpus.
If 'all' is used as a value, we'll then take all available cpus,
computed by: "0-" + str(psutil.cpu_count()-1)

If unset (default), the cpuset-cpus value is computed by using psutil with a
new function which returns a comma-separated list range of CPUs that a
container can use.

This parameter is particulary useful for NFV:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1750781
Indeed, for NFV workloads, in order to achieve 0 packet loss, linux processes,
ovs-dpdk (if applicable) and VMs are isolated thanks to kernel args (isolcpus)
and tuned profiles (cpu-partitioning).

Change-Id: Ifdfe9b06472b6f5c8ec6e43ff3f6910f22c2c5e7

commit_message:
podman_container: configure cpuset_cpus automatically

Port what was done in I9443ad60affe9c7823b17daa259efee542c6fe22

Limit the specific CPUs or cores a container can use.

If cpuset-cpus is configured in the container layout, then the value
will be used when running the container cli with --cpuset-cpus.
If 'all' is used as a value, we'll then take all available cpus,
computed by: "0-" + str(psutil.cpu_count()-1)

If unset (default), the cpuset-cpus value is computed by using psutil with a
new function which returns a comma-separated list range of CPUs that a
container can use.

This parameter is particulary useful for NFV:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1750781
Indeed, for NFV workloads, in order to achieve 0 packet loss, linux processes,
ovs-dpdk (if applicable) and VMs are isolated thanks to kernel args (isolcpus)
and tuned profiles (cpu-partitioning).

Change-Id: Ifdfe9b06472b6f5c8ec6e43ff3f6910f22c2c5e7

commit_message:
linuxscsi: Stop waiting for multipath devices during extend_volume

Previously linuxscsi.extend_volume would always attempt to wait for
multipath devices to appear regardless of multipath actually being used
by the connector.

This change corrects this by passing down the existing use_multipath
attribute from the iSCSI and FC connectors into linuxscsi.extend_volume.
The same attribute is introduced to the NVMe connector to also allow it
to skip this search for multipath devices.

Conflicts:
    os_brick/initiator/connectors/nvme.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Due to I6b70140be7023770b83603de723d6d2de3ebb747 not
being present in stable/queens.

Change-Id: I29d65ae036957f3a63cba93dd330b14e3361a1b9
Closes-bug: #1832247
(cherry picked from commit 9cf135c68640f81838e2898b4aef3e0445770089)
(cherry picked from commit 3eee28ce33df69cb4605338f140d2fa6e22bcd88)

[{'created': '2020-01-21 12:00:24.000000000', 'message': 'Prepare oc_roles fact more efficiently

Currently the oc_roles fact preparation takes 4 tasks
and multiple data manipulations with multiple facts.

The extra unused facts are left in memory, continuing
to consume memory until the playbook completes. Multiple
tasks take longer to execute than a single task.

In this patch we reduce it down to a single task which
achieves exactly the same result more efficiently.

Change-Id: I5cfc593af63db5f885bcda5094340bcc1bf97047
'}, {'created': '2020-01-21 12:21:43.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure oc_roles and oc_roles_hosts are properly prepared

Currently with_dict loops are used to compile oc_roles. This
is inefficient and unnnecessary because we can prepare the
fact using filters instead. This also ensures that the result
is just a list and will not end up being a string unexpectedly.

We also do something similar for the controller_role_name fact.
To ensure like behaviour we pick the last item in the list from
the match.

Finally, for the oc_roles_hosts fact loop we ensure that the
syntax is updated to work with more up-to-date Ansible.

Change-Id: I5cfc593af63db5f885bcda5094340bcc1bf97047
'}, {'created': '2020-01-21 12:24:30.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure oc_roles and oc_roles_hosts are properly prepared

Change-Id: I5cfc593af63db5f885bcda5094340bcc1bf97047

To ensure that controllers_from_inventory is returned as a list

Change-Id: I5cfc593af63db5f885bcda5094340bcc1bf97047

[a] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/2.8/user_guide/playbooks_python_version.html#python-version-and-templating
Change-Id: I5cfc593af63db5f885bcda5094340bcc1bf97047

commit_message:
Ensure oc_roles and oc_roles_hosts are properly prepared

Currently with_dict loops are used to compile oc_roles. This
is inefficient and unnnecessary because we can prepare the
fact using filters instead. This also ensures that the result
is just a list and will not end up being a string unexpectedly.

We also do something similar for the controller_role_name fact.
To ensure like behaviour we pick the last item in the list from
the match.

To ensure that controllers_from_inventory is returned as a list
(which is expected) and not as dict_keys(...) with python3 we
use the list filter. See [a] for more information about this.

Finally, for the oc_roles_hosts fact loop we ensure that the
syntax is updated to work with more up-to-date Ansible.

[a] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/2.8/user_guide/playbooks_python_version.html#python-version-and-templating
Change-Id: I5cfc593af63db5f885bcda5094340bcc1bf97047

[{'created': '2019-12-03 15:40:10.000000000', 'message': 'iscsi: Add _get_device_link retry when waiting for /dev/disk/by-id/ to populate

Bug #1820007 documents failures to find /dev/disk/by-id/ symlinks
associated with encrypted volumes both in real world and CI
environments. These failures appear to be due to udev on these slow or
overloaded hosts failing to populate the required /dev/disk/by-id/
symlinks in time after the iSCSI volume has been connected.

This change seeks to avoid such failures by simply decorating
_get_device_link with the @utils.retry to hopefully allow udev time to
create the required symlinks under /dev/disk/by-id/.

Closes-Bug: #1820007
Change-Id: Ib9c8ebae7a6051e18538920139fecd123682a474

'}]
commit_message:
iscsi: Add _get_device_link retry when waiting for /dev/disk/by-id/ to populate

Bug #1820007 documents failures to find /dev/disk/by-id/ symlinks
associated with encrypted volumes both in real world and CI
environments. These failures appear to be due to udev on these slow or
overloaded hosts failing to populate the required /dev/disk/by-id/
symlinks in time after the iSCSI volume has been connected.

This change seeks to avoid such failures by simply decorating
_get_device_link with the @utils.retry to hopefully allow udev time to
create the required symlinks under /dev/disk/by-id/.

Closes-Bug: #1820007
Change-Id: Ib9c8ebae7a6051e18538920139fecd123682a474
(cherry picked from commit 331316827a60aa50ee26be08a06027525f5194ef)
(cherry picked from commit d8ed21e7d25f67c6d2bfe71515723f68ce15b887)
(cherry picked from commit 7ffa3fb7d9d497fd3848ab0313ba8aa84136a06e)
(cherry picked from commit ed9feedfa3f9a434a0bbd48953262fbb2999465b)

commit_message:
Adds standard file operation functions

This patch adds some standard file handle functions to the
FileHandle class.

This adds
seek
fileno
tell
flush

Change-Id: I2ae5af9f79732a757788a03f2aabdf784f461d40

commit_message:
[WIP] Add tripleo rgw keystone resource role

This change adds a tripleo-keystone role to add
a new keystone service, the related user/roles
and the endpoint to the catalog.
We're currently using it with CephRgw but it
can be reused from other services providing the
proper inputs.

Change-Id: I301880223013f76b6deeabac39b53cadba9a8025

commit_message:
[WIP] Remove ceph_rgw_enabled dependency to keystone

This change removes the ceph_rgw_enabled dependency
to keystone puppet module: this avoid the create the
rgw endpoint on step 3.

Change-Id: Ia8cce361195058dc270b55e8d78d42c9f8c0312c

commit_message:
WIP/DNM: Create swift user for RGW in keystone without puppet-ceph

Ceph RGW requires a swift user in keystone. Create this user when
deploying RGW using the tripleo-ansible keystone role in
place of puppet-ceph's rgw::keystone::auth.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676418
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676419
Change-Id: Ic56d6b86c433855c5dfd4bd33a7cc25675cc74b2

commit_message:
Make tripleO CI job non-voting

* TripleO is going to stop using Mistral soon and it has now lots
  of CI issues, so it makes sense to make this job non-voting now
  and remove later completely.

commit_message:
Switch from using cat to slurp

Slurp is binary safe, ensuring that all contents of the file
are never interpreted or changed during ingestion or transit.

As a preventative measure we should always use it rather than
assume that using cat will result in safe content transit.

Note that tasks/common/adjust-roles-data.yaml is left as-is
due to the change to use slurp already being included in
Iecf2b0211a69e99efe0f402efb00c7080b784104

Change-Id: Ib8309dca36ac804ec17761f6301b1b220411afff
(cherry picked from commit 4ea17b785a7513718698404433f3fbab7d109128)

Introduces [console]port_range configuration option and implements
the feature of automatic port allocation for IPMI based serial console.

The ipmi_terminal_port in driver_info takes precedance if specified,
otherwise ironic will allocate free port from configured port range
for underlying serial proxy tools.

Change-Id: If8722d09dc74878f4da2e4a7f059d9b079c3e472
Story: 2007099
Task: 38135
'}, {'created': '2020-02-10 08:11:18.000000000', 'message': "Automatic port allocation for the serial console

Introduces [console]port_range configuration option and implements
the feature of automatic port allocation for IPMI based serial console.

The ipmi_terminal_port in driver_info takes precedance if specified,
otherwise ironic will allocate free port from configured port range
for underlying serial proxy tools.

The implementation deviation with the original proposal is this patch
doesn't validate whether user specified ipmi_terminal_port falls in the
range, based on following considerations:
a. ipmi_terminal_port is considered a resort for backwards compatibility,
we will remove this eventually.
b. different conductors may have different port range configured (rare,
but could happen).
c. force ipmi_terminal_port in the port range could raise the
possibility of conflicts with ports in the configured range, this is not
a desired result, so leave the choice to the end users.

Change-Id: If8722d09dc74878f4da2e4a7f059d9b079c3e472
Story: 2007099
Task: 38135
"}]
commit_message:
Automatic port allocation for the serial console

Introduces [console]port_range configuration option and implements
the feature of automatic port allocation for IPMI based serial console.

The ipmi_terminal_port in driver_info takes precedance if specified,
otherwise ironic will allocate free port from configured port range
for underlying serial proxy tools.

The implementation deviation with the original proposal is this patch
doesn't validate whether user specified ipmi_terminal_port falls in the
range, based on following considerations:
a. ipmi_terminal_port is considered a resort for backwards compatibility,
we will remove this eventually.
b. different conductors may have different port range configured (rare,
but could happen).
c. force ipmi_terminal_port in the port range could raise the
possibility of conflicts with ports in the configured range, this is not
a desired result, so leave the choice to the end users.

Change-Id: If8722d09dc74878f4da2e4a7f059d9b079c3e472
Story: 2007099
Task: 38135

commit_message:
Split connector list by platform

We'll keep separate lists of connectors for each of the supported
operating systems so that we don't end up trying to use unsupported
connectors.

Since Cinder is explicitly trying to use the iSCSI/FC connectors,
we'll have to include those as well, for now.

Change-Id: Ibec2b798e8c5c3457cebea12cfd2f5813e62fb9e
Closes-Bug: #1850109
(cherry picked from commit 9e8657dd6ef781d7e6027625fc2f05442256c6ac)

commit_message:
Enforce "qos_max_rate" and "qos_burst" in OVN QoS options

If QoS rule is QosBandwidthLimitRule, then the generated options in
the QoS OVN driver of the QoS service should contain those two
parameters: "qos_max_rate" and "qos_burst".

According to [1], the units used are:
- qos_max_rate: kbps, the one used in Neutron
- qos_burst: kilobits, the one used in Neutron

A "rule.max_kbps" value should be always present in the rule, but not
"rule.max_burst_kbps". This value can be None in
OvnNbApiIdlImpl.QoSAddCommand.

[1]http://www.openvswitch.org/support/dist-docs/ovn-nbctl.8.html

Change-Id: Ie1598be7d21f33df6b1a66fa71ba6783d2433dca
Closes-Bug: #1861680

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-17 15:27:17.000000000', 'message': "Improve step task check to cater for whitespace

Currently a conditional of '(step | int) == 1' will not pass
the regex check because of the additional whitespace on either
side of the filter. There are many other whitespace variations
which could also make it fail, so rather than add a bunch of
\s* into the regex, we opt to remove all whitespace from the
string instead before doing the regex match.

This ensures that we're only running the step tasks when we
should, rather than having these tasks added into all generated
plays.

Change-Id: I589406f30f7b08bc28d05632bd97392f8b3623bf
"}]
commit_message:
Improve step task check to cater for whitespace

Currently a conditional of '(step | int) == 1' will not pass
the regex check because of the additional whitespace on either
side of the filter. There are many other whitespace variations
which could also make it fail, so rather than add a bunch of
\s* into the regex, we opt to remove all whitespace from the
string instead before doing the regex match.

This ensures that we're only running the step tasks when we
should, rather than having these tasks added into all generated
plays.

Change-Id: I589406f30f7b08bc28d05632bd97392f8b3623bf

commit_message:
add support for rhel8/centos8 virthosts

Enable the use of CentOS or RHEL as a
virthost for the undercloud/overcloud
deployment.

Fix bug w/ python mismatch w/ delegation
in the virtbmc role.

Change-Id: I8455f4272cf062d63258e8f6bd4c731062322538

commit_message:
Remove default ansible option in test runs

This change removes the default ansible option in test runs. This is being
removed because if any args are presnet the test job will only run one
scenario, which is "default", unless otherwise defined.

Change-Id: I0fac174ef4ac801f6bb96e06eed0a29e3a064d27
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3928fb6691cf8247c629b56521b408bf8448e011)

(1 comment)

I'm not sure whether there should be a deprecation phase for the old command first, so users can migrate softly.

I do think that this warrants a release note, though."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-01-06 10:20:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

If we follow the convention we use for agents who host networks/routers [1], how about "openstack bgp dragent list --bgp speaker <speaker>"? "openstack network agent list --agent-type bgp" shows the list of DR agents, but I think we can also "openstack bgp dragent list" too for the same purpose. Thought?

-1 is due to no release note and no deprecation period. The above is an suggestion/idea.


[1] https://docs.openstack.org/python-openstackclient/latest/cli/command-objects/network-agent.html#network-agent-list'}, {'account_id': 29157, 'date': '2020-01-07 07:42:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 29157, 'date': '2020-01-07 07:52:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Replace 'bgp speaker show dragents' with 'bgp dragent list'

In order to follow other agent related commands in OSC, it is more
appropriate and friendly to replace 'bgp speaker show dragents' with
'bgp dragent list'. this patch uses 'openstack bgp dragent list' to
show the list of dragents, and the optional parameter 'bgp-speaker'
shows the list of dragents hosting a specific bgp speaker.

Change-Id: I9e0703fccf535b1e1a2055ed917336055b7395f5
Closes-Bug: #1858377

[{'created': '2020-02-14 10:00:43.000000000', 'message': 'Make healthchecks more strict

It was discovered that healthchecks aren't really reliable because they
aren't strict enough.

The current patch adds the "standard" options in order to ensure we
actually catch errors soon enough in order to return the actual state of
the checked element.

It also requires a small change for the healthcheck_port() function,
since the "piping" returned a 141 code instead of 0 due SIGPIPE being
sent at some point[1].

[1] https://stackoverflow.com/questions/19120263/why-exit-code-141-with-grep-q
    http://www.tldp.org/LDP/lpg/node20.html

commit_message:
Make healthchecks more strict

It was discovered that healthchecks aren't really reliable because they
aren't strict enough.

The current patch adds the "standard" options in order to ensure we
actually catch errors soon enough in order to return the actual state of
the checked element.

It also requires a small change for the healthcheck_port() function,
since the "piping" returned a 141 code instead of 0 due SIGPIPE being
sent at some point[1].

[1] https://stackoverflow.com/questions/19120263/why-exit-code-141-with-grep-q
    http://www.tldp.org/LDP/lpg/node20.html

Change-Id: If13b6ca177d47a0af29ba5e5099e040eea62876c
Closes-Bug: #1860556
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1794044

'}, {'created': '2020-02-17 13:53:43.000000000', 'message': "Configure Undercloud hostname in the overcloud during upgrade.

Due to IPv6, the undercloud's container registry had to change
from an IP address in the full hostname [0]. This impacts into
the upgrade to Train as the overcloud nodes do not contain the
Undercloud's host in /etc/hosts as well as it's missing in the
registries.conf.

This patch adds two new upgrade tasks to handle:

1. container-image-prepare: Ensure that /etc/hosts file contains
an entry for the Undercloud's ctrlplane hostname. This task makes
use of the global_vars ansible parameter undercloud_hosts_entry
which contains a list of the undercloud's ctrlplan hostnames (calling
getent hosts underneath).

2. podman-baremetal-ansible: There is already an upgrade task which
takes care of reconfiguring podman during the upgrade, so this patch
simply sets up the right container unsecure registries and passes it
into the reconfiguring task. It also changes the (step | int) into
step|int as the upgrade tasks require step|int condition to decide in
which step_X playbook fall, otherwise the task will appear in every
step_X playbook.

[0] - Iac6efde9dd283906274d95c3a239b4b882ec052e

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/708128
Change-Id: Ifadc797f33d759eed38c9d9274fa588b6dd19488

commit_message:
Configure Undercloud hostname in the overcloud during upgrade.

Due to IPv6, the undercloud's container registry had to change
from an IP address in the full hostname [0]. This impacts into
the upgrade to Train as the overcloud nodes do not contain the
Undercloud's host in /etc/hosts as well as it's missing in the
registries.conf.

This patch adds two new upgrade tasks to handle:

1. container-image-prepare: Ensure that /etc/hosts file contains
an entry for the Undercloud's ctrlplane hostname. This task makes
use of the global_vars ansible parameter undercloud_hosts_entry
which contains a list of the undercloud's ctrlplan hostnames (calling
getent hosts underneath).

2. podman-baremetal-ansible: There is already an upgrade task which
takes care of reconfiguring podman during the upgrade, so this patch
simply sets up the right container unsecure registries and passes it
into the reconfiguring task. It also changes the (step | int) into
step|int as the upgrade tasks require step|int condition to decide in
which step_X playbook fall, otherwise the task will appear in every
step_X playbook.

[0] - Iac6efde9dd283906274d95c3a239b4b882ec052e

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/708128
Closes-Bug: #1863598
Change-Id: Ifadc797f33d759eed38c9d9274fa588b6dd19488

commit_message:
Remove static reference to InternalApi network

The InternalApi network had a hard-coded reference in
multiple-nics-vlans, this change removes that hard-coded
reference and replaces it with the correct reference.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/706196/

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-18 09:11:38.000000000', 'message': 'Create volume form raw image failed when qemu-img is not installed

Get the minimal size(for image-volume) will use qemu-img directly.
It will raise ProcessExecutionError even if the image is raw(but
actually we can use volume_utils.copy_volume to copy data).
This patch fix this:
1. If image is not raw and qemu-img is not installed, it will failed(
   covered by: image_utils.TemporaryImages.fetch -> fetch_verify_image
   -> get_qemu_data).
2. If image is raw and qemu-img is not installed, it will work
   fine after this fix.
3. If qemu-img is installed(whatever the disk format of the image),
   it will work fine as well.

Change-Id: I750568d65c2e09c29bdd4d01227b179393a68ff8
Closes-Bug: #1825326

commit_message:
Fix creation from raw image failed when qemu-img is not installed

Get the minimal size(for image-volume) will use qemu-img directly.
It will raise ProcessExecutionError even if the image is raw(but
actually we can use volume_utils.copy_volume to copy data).
This patch fix this:
1. If image is not raw and qemu-img is not installed, it will failed(
   covered by: image_utils.TemporaryImages.fetch -> fetch_verify_image
   -> get_qemu_data).
2. If image is raw and qemu-img is not installed, it will work
   fine after this fix.
3. If qemu-img is installed(whatever the disk format of the image),
   it will work fine as well.

Change-Id: I750568d65c2e09c29bdd4d01227b179393a68ff8
Closes-Bug: #1825326

commit_message:
[2/2] Fix mock for sleep mocks in volume drivers tests

According to `Applying the same patch to every test method` section in
the [1] we shouldn't use mock decorators on setUp method. This patch fixes it
moving mocks into the setUp methods.

This patch fixes time.sleep mocks in IBM driver.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3.5/library/unittest.mock-examples.html

Change-Id: I274a23272ff74bcefe78f2d2e9e7f77a7cc160b6

commit_message:
Allow NFS snaphot clone in 'backing-up' state

Now it is possible to create cinder backups for snapshots when NFS volume
driver is used.

Change-Id: Idfb812457f5a46fc1b2e90c4475a6adb7ca502ff
Implements: blueprint nfs-snaphot-backup

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-30 09:57:19.000000000', 'message': "Force facts cache refreshing after OS upgrade.

When upgrading from Rocky to Stein, an upgrade of the operating system is
performed. This upgrade from RHEL7 to RHEL8 implies the removal of the
default /usr/bin/python binary. As the facts cache is enabled, Ansible's
strategy does not consider to upgrade facts and therefore we try to run the
ansible playbook using the old python binary when running the upgrade.
This fails with the error: /usr/bin/python: No such file or directory.

This patch makes use of the setup task in combination with clear_facts
right after rebooting to upgrade the operating system, to ensure that
the facts are gathered and refreshed for the Overcloud node just upgraded.
This way, we make sure that we are using the right python binary.

Closes-Bug: #1856313
Change-Id: Ia1fa60c22e482ab14a509730cf93634772e077a7
"}]
commit_message:
Force facts cache refreshing after OS upgrade.

When upgrading from Rocky to Stein, an upgrade of the operating system is
performed. This upgrade from RHEL7 to RHEL8 implies the removal of the
default /usr/bin/python binary. As the facts cache is enabled, Ansible's
strategy does not consider to upgrade facts and therefore we try to run the
ansible playbook using the old python binary when running the upgrade.
This fails with the error: /usr/bin/python: No such file or directory.

This patch makes use of the setup task in combination with clear_facts
right after rebooting to upgrade the operating system, to ensure that
the facts are gathered and refreshed for the Overcloud node just upgraded.
This way, we make sure that we are using the right python binary.

Closes-Bug: #1856313

commit_message:
Release sushy 2.0.2

Releases sushy 2.0.2 with some validation fixes where we found
our validation checking was made too strict in the prior cycle,
leading to some BMC interactions failing.

subject: Puppet OpenStack Ussuri Milestone 2
messages:
[{'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2020-02-17 07:57:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-02-17 15:32:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(43 comments)

Hello,

Many projects shouldn't release a minor version, see my inline comments."}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2020-02-18 02:37:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The version of the puppet openstack project is different from that of other projects. The version must be the same as that in the metadata.json file.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-02-18 07:26:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

> The version of the puppet openstack project is different from that
 > of other projects. The version must be the same as that in the
 > metadata.json file.

Ah ok I was not aware of this rule, it's a little bit annoying because many releases does not really reflect associated changes

Considering the huge amount of changes needed to address my comments I don't think that this is something that you want to consider, I'm right?

Since you are the PTL/liaison of this team, I think we are "safe" here, so I remove my -1 and move to +1 only for now by waiting other team release member feedbacks and if they will be okay with these changes too then I'll +2 too. In other words looks good to me, but someone else must approve.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-02-18 10:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Refstack is managed by the InteropWG, which pushes releases for
it directly. At this point it's better to consider that it was never
release-managed, especially since its deliverables were not really part

Align python-tempestconf (also managed by the InteropWG) accordingly.

commit_message:
No longer release-manage Refstack deliverables

Refstack is managed by the InteropWG, which pushes releases for
it directly. At this point it's better to consider that it was never
release-managed, especially since its deliverables were not really part
of the OpenStack release.

Align python-tempestconf (also managed by the InteropWG) accordingly.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/706479
Change-Id: Ie2f7d28116d07112bb201c77b6edd18d99c7b1d2

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/706479
Change-Id: I8dafe84387ca1c233b9608367e20fcc50e4f062c
"}]
commit_message:
No longer release-manage syntribos

Syntribos is produced by the Security SIG, and was never really
a part of an openstack release. Let's enable them to release directly.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/706479
Change-Id: I8dafe84387ca1c233b9608367e20fcc50e4f062c

2020-02-14 12:44:22.200822 | ubuntu-bionic |         self.assertTrue(reflection.is_same_callback(b.b, c.b, strict=False))
2020-02-14 12:44:22.200835 | ubuntu-bionic |       File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/oslo.utils/.tox/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/unittest2/case.py", line 702, in assertTrue
2020-02-14 12:44:22.200847 | ubuntu-bionic |         raise self.failureException(msg)
2020-02-14 12:44:22.200859 | ubuntu-bionic |     AssertionError: False is not true
```

I think we face a future py38 issue here... where some behaviours changed with this python version.

Apparently it come from [1][2][3], I think that if we move away from six we could drop good part of code here.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.utils/blob/d3d117112e26e25bf81b0be3a8df26e6cf191b0e/oslo_utils/reflection.py#L166,L186
[2] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.utils/blob/d3d117112e26e25bf81b0be3a8df26e6cf191b0e/oslo_utils/reflection.py#L156,L163
[3]https://six.readthedocs.io/#six.get_method_self'}]

commit_message:
Fix Windows support for the unit tests

We've been running the unit tests mostly on Linux as part of the
CI test jobs.

On Windows, some of the tests fail mostly due to the WMI lib not
being mocked correctly. This issue is addressed by this change.

Change-Id: Ib4de3d262a7cf98a552f6234f6561d6c87b2067d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-11 11:06:33.000000000', 'message': "Add configurable timeout for in-use files

In some cases, Hyper-V locks on VHD images persist for a few seconds
even after the instances are deleted (not sure if that's due to
Hyper-V or the filesystem). In order to mitigate this, we're
already performing some retries when deleting instance files.

We've encountered similar issues with 3rd party backup tools
that kept open file handles.

This change adds a configurable timeout that will be used when waiting
for in-use fles. The default value is 15 seconds, slightly more than
the current hardcoded value. At the same time, this timeout will
also be used when deleting individual files or renaming folders or
files.

Change-Id: I49307146b79a20089190e1ce8bde73d656d37c6d

commit_message:
Add configurable timeout for in-use files

In some cases, Hyper-V locks on VHD images persist for a few seconds
even after the instances are deleted (not sure if that's due to
Hyper-V or the filesystem). In order to mitigate this, we're
already performing some retries when deleting instance files.

We've encountered similar issues with 3rd party backup tools
that kept open file handles.

This change adds a configurable timeout that will be used when waiting
for in-use fles. The default value is 15 seconds, slightly more than
the current hardcoded value. At the same time, this timeout will
also be used when deleting individual files or renaming folders or
files.

Change-Id: I49307146b79a20089190e1ce8bde73d656d37c6d

[{'created': '2020-02-11 14:00:02.000000000', 'message': "Allow limitting concurrent image ops

Nova defines a config option that allows limitting concurrent
image operations. This behavior is disabled by default.

The threshold is enforced using a semaphore, which we're now going
to use.

As opposed to the libvirt driver, we're not applying the semaphore
when merging differencing images since that would have a larger
impact on the hyper-v driver (e.g. when resizing legacy vhd images,
when deleting temporary snapshots, etc). For now, we're using it
only when downloading or uploading glance images.

Change-Id: I74ecf4b343428c71aad77b049faa5d2382e88dc8

commit_message:
Allow limitting concurrent image ops

Nova defines a config option that allows limitting concurrent
image operations. This behavior is disabled by default.

The threshold is enforced using a semaphore, which we're now going
to use.

As opposed to the libvirt driver, we're not applying the semaphore
when merging differencing images since that would have a larger
impact on the hyper-v driver (e.g. when resizing legacy vhd images,
when deleting temporary snapshots, etc). For now, we're using it
only when downloading or uploading glance images.

Change-Id: I74ecf4b343428c71aad77b049faa5d2382e88dc8
blueprint: io-semaphore-for-concurrent-disk-ops

commit_message:
Support preemptible instances with Blazar

This spec proposes to add support for preemptible instances with Blazar.
It would allow to increase utilization by filling gaps between
reservations, as well as provide an implementation of preemptible
instances that does not require modifications to the Nova compute
service.

Change-Id: Iba016a52666d44c82ea7c820814b18952dcaf9ed

commit_message:
Trivial: Fix test_get_cluster_group_type on x86 or Win32

One unit test is using the wrong type, unsigned long long instead of
long, for which reason it will fail on Linux x86 or Windows, where
the size of those types do not match.

Change-Id: If49e57ada8d367f537710974ea59728d20720275
Closes-Bug: 1850770

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-12 22:15:25.000000000', 'message': "Don't get frozen definitions for resource being deleted

At the start of a legacy stack update, we calculate the frozen definitions
for all of the existing resources. This is so that we can later compare
them against the new resources to see if they need to be updated.

Since resources that are being deleted (i.e. don't appear in the new
template) won't ever need to be compared to the new definitions, there's no
need for us to calculate this data.

Apparently there are (extremely rare) situations where getting the frozen
definitions will fail, so this at least gives users an opportunity to
recover by deleting only the resources causing trouble rather than the
whole stack.

Change-Id: I04bed83cc2181e1e61bf90c2f259cfd123362b06
Story: 2002966
Task: 22972
"}, {'created': '2019-12-23 18:41:27.000000000', 'message': "Don't get frozen definitions for resource being deleted

Since resources that are being deleted (i.e. don't appear in the new
template) won't ever need to be compared to the new definitions, there's no
need for us to calculate this data.

Apparently there are (extremely rare) situations where getting the frozen
definitions will fail, so this at least gives users an opportunity to
recover by deleting only the resources causing trouble rather than the
whole stack.

Change-Id: I04bed83cc2181e1e61bf90c2f259cfd123362b06
Story: 2002966

"}]
commit_message:
Don't get frozen definitions for resource being deleted

At the start of a legacy stack update, we calculate the frozen definitions
for all of the existing resources. This is so that we can later compare
them against the new resources to see if they need to be updated.

Since resources that are being deleted (i.e. don't appear in the new
template) won't ever need to be compared to the new definitions, there's no
need for us to calculate this data.

Apparently there are (extremely rare) situations where getting the frozen
definitions will fail, so this at least gives users an opportunity to
recover by deleting only the resources causing trouble rather than the
whole stack.

Change-Id: I04bed83cc2181e1e61bf90c2f259cfd123362b06
Story: 2002966
Task: 22972

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Cleanup for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

puppet-* repos have to cleanup the requirement and tox
for py2.7 drop.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Ie6907fa96712ccc17238bb4878997839c1290157

version that supports py3.

commit_message:
Ensures rsync is present on the overcloud nodes

When using pre-deployed nodes installed with minimal OS, it may happen
rsync is missing - this package is needed for the "Sync cached facts"
task for instance.

Change-Id: Ie8a1ad5e2c9e32cce1f1b8c264a8b44207d99b59
Closes-Bug: #1863216
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1802827
(cherry picked from commit 1121a6c8ee302c247e7be55b71656617fdc8c3cd)

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Cleanup for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

puppet-* repos have to cleanup the requirement and tox
for py2.7 drop.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Ide52fc374daac3d2b221cf0d70af002b7468387d

commit_message:
Add DeployIdentifier to extra config containers

Certain config containers might need to be replaced and re-run
regardless of whether configuration changes on update and upgrade.
Adding the DeployIdentifier to the env will ensure that they are.

Conflicts:
  deployment/mistral/mistral-api-container-puppet.yaml

Note: this cherry-pick is missing changes to
ovn-metadata-container-puppet.yaml that  were made in the original
patch because the systemd-tripleo-wrappers was backported, making this
particular change unnecessary.

Change-Id: I150212ebac3fed471ffb4e7ed7b6eb6c7af3fad9
Closes-Bug: #1860571
(cherry picked from commit 714e1b5d3120b1babfec01c15bf508cc9241ceb2)

[{'created': '2020-01-28 16:39:47.000000000', 'message': "Don't fetch entire list when looking up by ID

Blazar APIs support directly fetching a resource (whether host, floating
ip, or lease) with its ID. However, the default logic for this includes
a block that supports additionally looking up the resource by name (to
allow looking up e.g., a lease by it's name.) This requires fetching the
entire list of all resources and iterating over them until a match is
found, which is very inefficient. Moreover, this branch would be taken
even if the input was already a UUID.

used to directly fetch the resource, which seems to be what the original
intent was in the first place.

commit_message:
Don't fetch entire list when looking up by ID

Blazar APIs support directly fetching a resource (whether host, floating
ip, or lease) with its ID. However, the default logic for this includes
a block that supports additionally looking up the resource by name (to
allow looking up e.g., a lease by it's name.) This requires fetching the
entire list of all resources and iterating over them until a match is
found, which is very inefficient. Moreover, this branch would be taken
even if the input was already a UUID.

This commit changes that behavior so that if a UUID is provided, it is
used to directly fetch the resource, which seems to be what the original
intent was in the first place.

Change-Id: I5b1ccf4abfe4aa9068bc011764cac4b3507ef697

'}]
commit_message:
nova: Always provide LIBGUESTFS_BACKEND=libvirt:qemu:///system

Previously nova-compute would launch libguestfs using the default
``qemu:///session`` backend that would attempt and fail to launch an
instance of libvirtd locally within the container. This change forces
libguestfs to use the same ``qemu://system`` as nova-compute itself uses
when launching instances on the host.

Conflicts:
    deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict due to the move from docker/services to
deployment in Stein.

Change-Id: Ib55936ea562dfa965be0764647e2b8e3fa309fd6
(cherry picked from commit 948fc6bcbf9c7295c576b80553bf8b835675256b)
(cherry picked from commit 4feedd4f0a8c7c4d15c38ea1b7273a63922a37c8)
(cherry picked from commit 670d8049c852df93a889efbf04a653160856716b)

commit_message:
[stable/train only] Use service_name in heira for firewall rules

We look for tripleo::${service_name}::firewall_rules hiera when
configuring firewall for services using puppet.

Change-Id: I552449dcae725f84d9c131cb97a5c1ad168b8661
Related-Bug: #1858096

commit_message:
ovs-dpdk interworking with trunk

While creating br-trunk bridges, pass an additional argument, i.e.
datapath_type. This parameter is read from openvswitch.ini conf file.

Change-Id: I7f1285c00beeb38abec389e87425ca3dbc0abf4b

subject: s3api: Add basic support for ?versions bucket listings
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-06-15 20:24:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-08-17 18:06:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Cyberduck might be a good client to test with -- previously, you'd only see "subdirectories" when listing buckets; now you should see the objects, too.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-10-01 19:26:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-10-01 19:27:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Just rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-10-02 16:56:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2018-10-29 07:17:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Though that might be tradeoff thing, perhaps using another controller could avoid complex if/elif/else blocks in the code? I mean we could do like [1] for versions listing. it would make duplicated code to look up the object list...

1: https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/common/middleware/s3api/s3request.py#L966-L967'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2018-11-02 18:30:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

I'm ok with this patch but I think it would be nice to make a couple of changes.

The commit message title was a bit misleading, I had a hard time understanding what the patch was about just from reading the commit message. My understanding now is not that (swift) versioning is not enabled, it's specifically S3 versioning not being yet supported in s3api. Still we want to return the "latest" version when listing buckets with a "?versions" request, correct?

Agree with Kota that the multiple back and forth of if/else blocks makes the code a bit difficult to follow. I tried to consolidate the blocks a bit just to improve readibility/maintainbility[1], feel free to use or if you would like i can send a new patchset or also ignore me which is ok too :)

[1] - https://paste.fedoraproject.org/paste/G7jrJPxysM7sNs7aCB-gZg'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2018-11-07 07:53:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

I like the Thiago's diff to avoid the if blocks in the code so I wonder if Tim could squash that into here.

The interesting thing is that the listing format (via ?versions query) is different from normal object listing regardless of versioning enabled or not so this is the first step to support s3's object versioning. Actually, the commit message might be mis-leading so... something like:

 Fix object listing format when ?versions query requested

 Regardless of that the bucket versioning is enabled or not, "?versions" query 
 should return versioning listing format so this patch allows s3api is able to
 return with the format.

is nice to describe?

And reference to that api could help us to understand, https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/RESTBucketGETVersion.html'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-11-08 21:14:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-11-08 22:12:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

recheck

There were a couple FAILs in the py27 logs, but I'm guessing that's just because tests were taking >4x longer than normal."}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2018-11-08 23:16:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 29365, 'date': '2020-02-17 23:35:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I just tested this, and it appeared that boto3 based clients fail on https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/API_HeadBucket.html

"An error occurred (400) when calling the HeadBucket operation: Bad Request"'}, {'account_id': 29365, 'date': '2020-02-18 07:11:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

nm, the error message was confusing, I used wrong region.'}]

When processing GET requests for buckets with "?versions", at least get

Change-Id: Ic57c273a3d5d7cdc34ca3a03e35e99b202a0bb01
'}, {'created': '2018-11-08 21:14:34.000000000', 'message': 's3api: Add basic support for ?versions bucket listings

We still don't have support for toggling S3 bucket versioning, but we
can at least support getting the latest versions of all objects.

See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/RESTBucketGETVersion.html
for more information about the API. Note that the returned format is
distinct from both "GET Bucket (List Objects) Version 1" and "GET Bucket
(List Objects) Version 2" APIs.

Change-Id: Ic57c273a3d5d7cdc34ca3a03e35e99b202a0bb01
'}]
commit_message:
s3api: Add basic support for ?versions bucket listings

We still don't have support for toggling S3 bucket versioning, but we
can at least support getting the latest versions of all objects.

See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/RESTBucketGETVersion.html
for more information about the API. Note that the returned format is
distinct from both "GET Bucket (List Objects) Version 1" and "GET Bucket
(List Objects) Version 2" APIs.

Change-Id: Ic57c273a3d5d7cdc34ca3a03e35e99b202a0bb01

commit_message:
Update AFS granfana page

Update with release times provided by the afs volume release process
on mirror-update.opendev.org and add a secondary area with the
project. volumes for tracking release and space tracking as well (also
update the mirror volumes titles to make it clearer).

Change-Id: I4e6e99e60bfe2160e30cfc5ff54059adc66dacb1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-15 14:04:55.000000000', 'message': "List SG rules which belongs to tenant's SG

In case when user's security group contains rules created e.g.
by admin, and such rules has got admin's tenant as tenant_id,
owner of security group should be able to see those rules.
Some time ago this was addressed for request:

GET /v2.0/security-groups/<sec_group_id>

But it is also required to behave in same way for

GET /v2.0/security-group-rules

So this patch fixes this behaviour for listing of security
group rules.
To achieve that this patch also adds new policy rule:
ADMIN_OWNER_OR_SG_OWNER which is similar to already existing
ADMIN_OWNER_OR_NETWORK_OWNER used e.g. for listing or creating
ports.

Conflicts:
    neutron/conf/policies/security_group.py

commit_message:
List SG rules which belongs to tenant's SG

In case when user's security group contains rules created e.g.
by admin, and such rules has got admin's tenant as tenant_id,
owner of security group should be able to see those rules.
Some time ago this was addressed for request:

GET /v2.0/security-groups/<sec_group_id>

But it is also required to behave in same way for

GET /v2.0/security-group-rules

So this patch fixes this behaviour for listing of security
group rules.
To achieve that this patch also adds new policy rule:
ADMIN_OWNER_OR_SG_OWNER which is similar to already existing
ADMIN_OWNER_OR_NETWORK_OWNER used e.g. for listing or creating
ports.

Conflicts:
    neutron/conf/policies/security_group.py

Change-Id: I09114712582d2d38d14cf1683b87a8ce3a8e8c3c
Closes-Bug: #1824248
(cherry picked from commit b898d2e3c08b50e576ee849fbe8614c66f360c62)

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Cleanup for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

puppet-* repos have to cleanup the requirement and tox
for py2.7 drop.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Id66ad15ca22fabe965f06bd15bf4e2aa28102f16

[{'created': '2020-02-09 17:45:50.000000000', 'message': 'Use stable constraint for Tempest pinned stable branches

Stable branches till stable/rocky is using python
version <py3.6. Tempest test those branch in venv
but Tempest tox use the master upper-constraint[1]
which block installation due to dependencies
require >=py3.6. For exmaple, oslo.concurrency 4.0.0
is not compatible for <py3.6.

As we pin Tempest for EM stable brach, we should be
able to use stable constraint for Tempest installation
as well as while running during run-tempest playbook.

tox.ini is hard coded to use master constraint[1] which force
run-tempest to recreate the tox env and use the master constraint.
Fix for that- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705870/

nova-live-migration test hook run_test.sh needs to use the stable
u-c so that Tempest installation in venv will use stable
branch constraint.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/bc9fe8eca801f54915ff3eafa418e6e18ac2df63/tox.ini#L14

commit_message:
Use stable constraint for Tempest pinned stable branches

Stable branches till stable/rocky is using python
version <py3.6. Tempest test those branch in venv
but Tempest tox use the master upper-constraint[1]
which block installation due to dependencies
require >=py3.6. For exmaple, oslo.concurrency 4.0.0
is not compatible for <py3.6.

As we pin Tempest for EM stable brach, we should be
able to use stable constraint for Tempest installation
as well as while running during run-tempest playbook.

tox.ini is hard coded to use master constraint[1] which force
run-tempest to recreate the tox env and use the master constraint.
Fix for that- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705870/

nova-live-migration test hook run_test.sh needs to use the stable
u-c so that Tempest installation in venv will use stable
branch constraint.

Modify the irrelevant-files for nova-live-migration job to run
for run_test.sh script.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/bc9fe8eca801f54915ff3eafa418e6e18ac2df63/tox.ini#L14

Change-Id: I8190f93e0a754fa59ed848a3a230d1ef63a06abc
(cherry picked from commit 48a66c56441861a206f9369b8c242cfd4dffd80d)

commit_message:
Add missing translation support markings

This patch set adds translation support to some user facing strings
that are currently not marked for translation as they should be.

Change-Id: I432c909ff1749ee6c393de42081a09873b186543
Closes-Bug: #1862710

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Cleanup for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

puppet-* repos have to cleanup the requirement and tox
for py2.7 drop.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Iede3101ed50cc2d298422a68f7865126bd42b51f

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Cleanup for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

puppet-* repos have to cleanup the requirement and tox
for py2.7 drop.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I42ff4c125e42a2b65ac878523a19b55951bba8a6

subject: Do not inherit the calling ansible env by default
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-17 20:34:55.000000000', 'message': 'Remove new lines from env variables used by ceph-ansible

As per I428f6deb416b540dae552b5fc7a778cbc7505e8c ANSIBLE_*
environment variables are passed to Ansible executions which
are used to deploy Ceph. Those environment variables should
not have a new line as that could cause the ansible-playbook
execution to happen before the full command is passed. This
change removes new lines from the environment variables.

Change-Id: Ifa6d147664fc993ca08c8fb2efa860f7605628cb
Fixes-Bug: #1863629
'}, {'created': '2020-02-17 21:21:43.000000000', 'message': 'Do not inherit the calling ansible env by default

As per I428f6deb416b540dae552b5fc7a778cbc7505e8c ANSIBLE_*
environment variables are passed to Ansible executions which
are used to deploy Ceph.

The method of inheritance is fragile and possibly unsafe. This
patch disables inheritance by default. In inheritance feature
can be made more safe in subsequent patches for Related-Bug but
but this new default should stay.

Change-Id: Ifa6d147664fc993ca08c8fb2efa860f7605628cb
Fixes-Bug: #1863629
'}]
commit_message:
Do not inherit the calling ansible env by default

As per I428f6deb416b540dae552b5fc7a778cbc7505e8c ANSIBLE_*
environment variables are passed to Ansible executions which
are used to deploy Ceph.

The method of inheritance is fragile and possibly unsafe. This
patch disables inheritance by default. In inheritance feature
can be made more safe in subsequent patches for Related-Bug but
but this new default should stay.

Change-Id: Ifa6d147664fc993ca08c8fb2efa860f7605628cb
Fixes-Bug: #1863629

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-31 06:50:15.000000000', 'message': "Stop assuming python command is python 2.7

After Python 2 is getting unsupported, new distros
like CentOS 8 and RHEL8 has stopped providing 'python'
package forcing user to decide which alternative to
use by installing 'python2' or 'python3.x' package
and then setting python alternative.

This change is intended to make using python3 command as
much as possible and use it as default 'python' alternative
where needed.

The final goals motivating this change are:
 - stop using python2 as much as possible
 - help adding support for CentOS 8 and RHEL8

Change-Id: I1e90db987c0bfa6206c211e066be03ea8738ad3f

package forcing user to decide which alternative to
use by installing 'python2' or 'python3.x' package
and then setting python alternative.

This change is intended to make using python3 command as
much as possible and use it as default 'python' alternative
where needed.

The final goals motivating this change are:
 - stop using python2 as much as possible
 - help adding support for CentOS 8 and RHEL8

Change-Id: I1e90db987c0bfa6206c211e066be03ea8738ad3f
"}]
commit_message:
Use python3 as default python command

After Python 2 is getting unsupported, new distros
like CentOS 8 and RHEL8 have stopped providing 'python'
package forcing user to decide which alternative to
use by installing 'python2' or 'python3.x' package
and then setting python alternative.

This change is intended to make using python3 command as
much as possible and use it as default 'python' alternative
where needed.

The final goals motivating this change are:
 - stop using python2 as much as possible
 - help adding support for CentOS 8 and RHEL8

Change-Id: I1e90db987c0bfa6206c211e066be03ea8738ad3f

Fix idna lower-constraint to satisfy requests.

Similar to Ic06ac0f41767ca513c612b1ebb38d2ff92500ea5 :

Relax Paunch and allows an operator to apply a config on a specific
container without removing the other containers in the same config_id.
Thanks to the paunch apply (...) --cleanup=False, if a container is
installed on the host for a given config_id, but not in the given config
anymore; it won't be removed.

The cleanup still happens by default for backward compatibility.

Change-Id: I479eaa3b58c3df091e1b78a01c4fb0595d81b37c
"}]
commit_message:
Allow to not cleanup containers that aren't in config

Similar to Ic06ac0f41767ca513c612b1ebb38d2ff92500ea5 :

Relax Paunch and allows an operator to apply a config on a specific
container without removing the other containers in the same config_id.
Thanks to the paunch apply (...) --cleanup=False, if a container is
installed on the host for a given config_id, but not in the given config
anymore; it won't be removed.

The cleanup still happens by default for backward compatibility.

Change-Id: I479eaa3b58c3df091e1b78a01c4fb0595d81b37c

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-15 20:15:27.000000000', 'message': 'Install all requirements in docs builds

Change If86dd619402495d9d4470b14cb270fcf53db6794 removed installing
requirements from requirements.txt for doc jobs. These are actually
needed since the local project gets installed into the venv in order to
generate docs from the included docstrings. That installation works, but
since the requirements were not installed explicitly via the deps, those
requirements end up being installed without the upper-constraints
enforcement. This is especially problematic on stable branches, where
cinder install ends up pulling in requirements newer than what was used
for that branch.

Change-Id: Icdf80000287a43e1ff355d976f5a607543fd6d20
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Install all requirements in docs builds

Change If86dd619402495d9d4470b14cb270fcf53db6794 removed installing
requirements from requirements.txt for doc jobs. These are actually
needed since the local project gets installed into the venv in order to
generate docs from the included docstrings. That installation works, but
since the requirements were not installed explicitly via the deps, those
requirements end up being installed without the upper-constraints
enforcement. This is especially problematic on stable branches, where
cinder install ends up pulling in requirements newer than what was used
for that branch.

Change-Id: Icdf80000287a43e1ff355d976f5a607543fd6d20
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

find, including any that look like they're closed and have an -eol tag.
The old kilo branch in this repository has a jumbled history that
somehow makes it look like it should include tags that it doesn't. We
know that there are no release notes in that branch, because reno wasn't

commit_message:
Tell reno to ignore the kilo branch

When reno 3.x runs under setuptools, it scans all of the branches it can
find, including any that look like they're closed and have an -eol tag.
The old kilo branch in this repository has a jumbled history that
somehow makes it look like it should include tags that it doesn't. We
know that there are no release notes in that branch, because reno wasn't
adopted while it was open. The releasenotes/source/index.rst links to
separate release notes in the wiki.

This patch tells reno to ignore that branch so that it doesn't throw an
exception when it gets confused about the old tag.

Change-Id: Idd56c3f37d5786daae7181c36d38d267cbf1885c
Co-Authored-By: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-17 09:40:54.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecated the yamlutils module.

The pyyaml is now safe by default:

https://github.com/yaml/pyyaml/pull/74/files
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-18342

So the yamlutils is now useless. We can depracated it and then remove it.

Change-Id: Ibaf782786eef20d6895542e6e66ebf5befe434f0
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecated the yamlutils module.

The pyyaml is now safe by default:

https://github.com/yaml/pyyaml/pull/74/files
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-18342

So the yamlutils is now useless. We can depracated it and then remove it.

Change-Id: Ibaf782786eef20d6895542e6e66ebf5befe434f0

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-13 02:03:25.000000000', 'message': "Refactor image upload command

In preparation for supporting deploys on a glance-less undercloud,
this change refactors the upload command to move all glance
interacting logic into a glance adapter class. This will allow the
adapter abstraction to be used for an 'upload' adapter which only
copies files on the local disk.

This change also does the following:
- moves repeated update-or-upload logic to an adapter method, reducing
  the complexity of take_action
- cleans up the mock usage to consistently use the
  patch decorator - the current approach may be causing unit test
  failures in some environments
- removes the GlanceV1 implementation, since the V1 API was removed in
  Newton(!) this support is just a maintenance burden

Change-Id: Ie28dabaf07ed36adb3e8f07ca8c141f93a9d79cc
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

commit_message:
Refactor image upload command

In preparation for supporting deploys on a glance-less undercloud,
this change refactors the upload command to move all glance
interacting logic into a glance adapter class. This will allow the
adapter abstraction to be used for an 'upload' adapter which only
copies files on the local disk.

This change also does the following:
- moves repeated update-or-upload logic to an adapter method, reducing
  the complexity of take_action
- cleans up the mock usage to consistently use the
  patch decorator - the current approach may be causing unit test
  failures in some environments
- removes the GlanceV1 implementation, since the V1 API was removed in
  Newton(!) this support is just a maintenance burden

Change-Id: Ie28dabaf07ed36adb3e8f07ca8c141f93a9d79cc
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

Do not create symlink conf.d/post-deploy

This task was added to work-around a circular dependency in CI. It can
and should now be removed as it causes overcloud update converge to
fail.

Closes-Bug: #1863595

Add var to append to exclude list

The review adds a new variable called artcl_exclude_list_append
which can be set to extra exclude paths artcl_exclude_list will
be extended about.

commit_message:
Pass image import conf file to command which runs glance server

Glance recently has added plugin framework in which a new configuration file
has been added named glance-image-import.conf

In order to get this file read by glance api it need to be passed
to command running on glance_api container.

Closes-Bug: 1790090
Change-Id: I2a7861094bbc814ccd3ef3f2206dc141229411fc
(cherry picked from commit 2b78110ee9957257de57b988a7274d19d4b8209c)
(cherry picked from commit 55a12265e8496d94749a6cfb34a6e218e83d90d0)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-17 16:07:31.000000000', 'message': 'Install all requirements in docs builds

Change If86dd619402495d9d4470b14cb270fcf53db6794 removed installing
requirements from requirements.txt for doc jobs. These are actually
needed since the local project gets installed into the venv in order to
generate docs from the included docstrings. That installation works, but
since the requirements were not installed explicitly via the deps, those
requirements end up being installed without the upper-constraints
enforcement. This is especially problematic on stable branches, where
cinder install ends up pulling in requirements newer than what was used
for that branch.

Change-Id: Icdf80000287a43e1ff355d976f5a607543fd6d20
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit c6a1efa0280769bf3440a19e25041ef9319c623a)
'}]
commit_message:
Install all requirements in docs builds

Change If86dd619402495d9d4470b14cb270fcf53db6794 removed installing
requirements from requirements.txt for doc jobs. These are actually
needed since the local project gets installed into the venv in order to
generate docs from the included docstrings. That installation works, but
since the requirements were not installed explicitly via the deps, those
requirements end up being installed without the upper-constraints
enforcement. This is especially problematic on stable branches, where
cinder install ends up pulling in requirements newer than what was used
for that branch.

Change-Id: Icdf80000287a43e1ff355d976f5a607543fd6d20
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit c6a1efa0280769bf3440a19e25041ef9319c623a)

subject: Do not prematurely remove build dependencies
messages:
[{'account_id': 28397, 'date': '2020-02-17 22:02:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28397, 'date': '2020-02-17 22:03:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Backport-Candidate+1 Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28397, 'date': '2020-02-17 22:05:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This was initially observed in stable/train so it would be nice to have this backported there as well.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-02-17 22:09:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

I think this is a bug in the dkms element in diskimage-builder.

Per the diskimage-builder documentation: https://docs.openstack.org/diskimage-builder/latest/developer/developing_elements.html

"Elements in the upstream diskimage-builder elements should not create executables which run before 10- or after 90- in any of the phases if possible. This is to give downstream elements the ability to easily make executables which run after our upstream ones."

So, really dkms should run prior to the 9x- phases.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-02-17 22:10:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 28397, 'date': '2020-02-17 22:40:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I think this is a bug in the dkms element in diskimage-builder.
 > 
 > Per the diskimage-builder documentation: https://docs.openstack.org/diskimage-builder/latest/developer/developing_elements.html
 > 
 > "Elements in the upstream diskimage-builder elements should not
 > create executables which run before 10- or after 90- in any of the
 > phases if possible. This is to give downstream elements the ability
 > to easily make executables which run after our upstream ones."
 > 
 > So, really dkms should run prior to the 9x- phases.

Thanks for the feedback.

With that in mind, there are currently numerous post-install upstream executables which fall into those ranges:

 $ find elements -type f -wholename "*/post-install.d/9*" -o -wholename "*/post-install.d/0*" | sort
 elements/dkms/post-install.d/97-dkms
 elements/dracut-ramdisk/post-install.d/01-ensure-drivers
 elements/dracut-ramdisk/post-install.d/99-build-dracut-ramdisk
 elements/grub2/post-install.d/01-delete-grubenv
 elements/hpdsa/post-install.d/95-hpdsa
 elements/hpdsa/post-install.d/98-hpdsa-post-dkms
 elements/iso/post-install.d/01-copy-bootloaders
 elements/openssh-server/post-install.d/99-harden-sshd-config
 elements/package-installs/post-install.d/00-package-installs
 elements/package-installs/post-install.d/95-package-uninstalls
 elements/pypi/post-install.d/00-unconfigure-pypi-mirror
 elements/ramdisk/post-install.d/99-build-ramdisk
 elements/ramdisk-base/post-install.d/01-ensure-binaries
 elements/rpm-distro/post-install.d/06-network-config-nonzeroconf
 elements/ubuntu-signed/post-install.d/90-get-signed-kernel
 elements/yum/post-install.d/99-reset-yum-conf
 elements/zypper/post-install.d/98-zypper-clean-cache
 elements/zypper/post-install.d/99-zypper-no-keep-packages
 elements/zypper-minimal/post-install.d/01-locale-cleanup

Should we change the remove-build-deps script in Octavia or work to change the executable indices in upstream diskimage-builder?

My fear is that changing the indexes upstream may have have larger fallout.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-17 22:02:45.000000000', 'message': 'Do not prematurely remove build dependencies

The dkms element has a post-install.d entry with an index of 97.
When the build dependencies outlined in this script are removed,
dkms is removed as a dependency, causing the dkms step to fail.

Change-Id: Ie3f11f240e57ce3b272a2c0c79d89172e9ddc363
'}]
commit_message:
Do not prematurely remove build dependencies

The dkms element has a post-install.d entry with an index of 97.
When the build dependencies outlined in this script are removed,
dkms is removed as a dependency, causing the dkms step to fail.

Change-Id: Ie3f11f240e57ce3b272a2c0c79d89172e9ddc363

commit_message:
Add support to run Container Puppet tasks without Paunch

Deploy the container-puppet-* containers with tripleo-container-manage
instead of container-puppet.py which uses Paunch.

This is the last piece where Paunch isn't used anymore in the
deployment.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/707905

Change-Id: I6fdf03a639ca63047fdd6ef603f549781a06d07b
(cherry picked from commit ed720b0c832ca97dff32586b15c1d7034dadd315)

commit_message:
Build Ceph images with Ceph Nautilus 14.2.7 packages

The Ceph package repo has been updated to include Nautilus 14.2.7
packages so this ps will generate new docker images for all ceph
components.

This ps also updates  provisioners to latest tags available in quay.io
